page.title: 08Transport
page.content: Port Talbot bus station is used a lot. Altogether 96 people work at the bus station but of these 64 are drivers. On a typical day about 2,000 use the bus station. Sunday is the quietest day and Thursday is the busiest. Port Talbot railway station's busiest time of the week is a Monday morning between 7.00 and 10.00 a.m. Sunday morning is the time which the station is least used. The trains which come into the station carry passengers, parcels, coal and oil. In a 15 minute traffic survey of the M4 at Baglan we observed 270 east-bound cars, 57 lorries, 64 vans, 2 buses and coaches and 8 other vehicles. We counted 282 cars, 43 lorries, 72 vans, 5 motor-cycles, 17 buses and coaches and 7 other vehicles which were west-bound.
